language.name: Kryz
language.alternative-names: Dzek, Dzhek, Dzheki, Katsy, Kryc, Kryts, Krits, Kryzy

semantics.note: to plough by using plough
to plough by using spade
to sow a cereal
to sow seeds
special pottery for saving butter and products during winter
clay pot for cooking bread in the tandoor
special pottery for making oil
special pottery for drinking a tea in a pasture
Winter pastures

lexeme.note: Loan from Azerbaijani "yaylaq - summer pastures; a mountain location suitable for summer rest".

semantics.note: Summer pastures

lexeme.note: Loan from Azerbaijani: "çin [čin]" is a type of sickle in Azerbaijani.
Loan from Persian "دانه [dâne]", borrowed through Azerbaijani "dən [dän] - grain (general)"

semantics.note: forest grape or wild grape

lexeme.note: Loan from Azerbaijani "fərə [färä]" means age between chicken and hen. In explanatory dictionary of Azerbaijani it is like "young hen".

semantics.note: age between chicken and hen
heifer
homeless dog
puppy

lexeme.note: Loan from Azerbaijani "tula - kind breed of dogs".

semantics.note: weak dog

lexeme.note: Loan from Azerbaijani "ördək - duck" (← from old Turkic (Old uyghur) ötrek/ödirek - a bird).

semantics.note: 1 year old female
breeder male goat
older than 2 years
female horse
castrated horse
breeder male horse
big male pig
dialect
general name
part of a herd of sheep that remained (lost) in the pasture

lexeme.note: Loan from Azerbaijani "dəmir - iron". Old Turkic temir/temür.

semantics.note: pebble or small stone
small stones in a cultivated field

lexeme.note: Loan from Azerbaijani "qarayaz - first month of a spring (in Gakh dialect)", "yaz - spring".

semantics.note: blunt knife

lexeme.note: Loan from Azerbaijani "qalxan - shield". (← Mahmud al-Kashgari "Compendium of the languages of the Turks" 1070: "kalkan/kalkaŋ". Compare to Mongolian "kalka - shield").
Loan from Azerbaijani "quzğun [guzʁun] - hawk, black bird". In Old Turkic "kuz [kuz]" means "sunless place, shadow, darkness".

language.name: Kabardian
language.alternative-names: East Circassian, Kabard, Kabardino-Cherkes, Kabardo-Cherkess, Upper Circassian

language.name: Adyghe
language.alternative-names: Adygei, Adygey, Kiakh, Kjax, Lower Circassian, Адыгабзэ, West Circassian

language.name: Ingush
language.alternative-names: ГӀалгӀай, Ghalghay, Ingouche, Ingus, Inguso, Kisti, Kistin

lexeme.note: Loan from Russian. (Rober Mobili shows it as tʰavar//t'apor in his dictionary)
q'ạvạn - Vartashen (Oghuz) dialect; qavun - Nij dialect

semantics.note: ga - place; otʰarišala ga - place for feed
wooden spade
grape variety with long and white berries
uč' - honey, t'at' - bee (t'at' also means fly)

lexeme.note: bele - Vartashen (Oghuz) dialect; beli - Nij dialect

semantics.note: hunting dog
bitch
mule

lexeme.note: Voroshil explanes "bạd-bạd" as voice imitation for calling ducks.

semantics.note: Also means duckling.

lexeme.note: Voroshil, as well as Klimov&Khalilov show like [k'ok'oc], but Robert Mobili as [k'ok'oc'].
ærkæ - loanword, meaning male; ẹk - horse

semantics.note: male horse
female horse
foal

lexeme.note: eʁel - Nij dialect, iʁel - Vartashen (Oghuz) dialect

semantics.note: ewe
pig leather, pigskin

lexeme.note: Voroshil shows as [učʰ], Klimov&Khalilov as [učč], Robert Mobili as [uč'].
eq' - Vartashen (Oghuz) dialect; yeq' - Nij dialect

semantics.note: last year's wine

lexeme.note: Klimov&Khalilov shows [pop] as wool, but in Voroshil and Robert's dictionaries it's as a hair. But in Voroshil and Robert's dictionaries there is a word bušejpʰopʰ (buš - camel, pʰopʰ -wool), which means camel wool.

semantics.note: Also means sabre
Sabre. Also means spear.
dagger

lexeme.note: aramt'or is Nij dialect, aramt'ol is Vartashen (Oghuz) dialect

language.name: Beshta
language.alternative-names: Bezhta, Bezheta, Kapucha, Bechitin, Bejila, Bexita, Bezhita, Bezhti, Kapuchin, Kupuca

semantics.note: jug
hook-bladed axe

lexeme.note: Nodar Ardoteli shows hæjmæn as Kap. dialect, hæjmal as Tl. dialect (loanword)

semantics.note: big hunting dog
puppy
mule
foal, colt
he-goat
foal, colt
foal, colt
little ox
they call "iqa-boc'i" for rams from Tusheti.
one year old sheep
sheep without offspring
yellow one
sheep's leather
grape juice
mountain wild bull

language.name: Khinalug
language.alternative-names: Khinalugh, Khinalig, Khinalugi, Xinalug, Xinalugh, Xinaliq, Jinalug, Khinalough

lexeme.note: Loan from Azerbaijani: "çin [čin]" is a type of sickle in Azerbaijani.
Loan from Persian "ارابه [araba] - wagon" (Connection to Sanskrit "rátha- रथ".)
Loan from Persian "چاودار [čavdar] - rye" borrowed through Azerbaijani "çovdar [čovdar] - rye".

semantics.note: Çovdari - rye, p̂arınż - rice. Rice of rye.

lexeme.note: Arı is a loan from Azerbaijani.

semantics.note: nüż - honey, arı - bee.

lexeme.note: Loan from Arabic "مال [mal] - wealth, income", "حيوان [ħjwn] - animal".

semantics.note: (cow who has not yet given birth)

lexeme.note: Loan from Azerbaijani "ördək - duck" (← from old Turkic (Old uyghur) ötrek/ödirek - a bird).

semantics.note: About 10 months old.
Calf.

lexeme.note: Bala is a loan from Azerbaijani which means 'child'.

semantics.note: With big horns.
Young sheep, which gave birth 1-3 times.

lexeme.note: Loan from Azerbaijani "anac - an animal, which gave many birth; big, strong".

semantics.note: Old sheep, which gave birth 5-7 times.

lexeme.note: Loan from Azerbaijani "qızıl [gɨzɨl] - gold". In Old Turkic it's "kızıl, kızğıl [kɨzɨl, kɨzʁɨl] - red (colour)".
Loan from Azerbaijani "odun [odun] - firewood". (← from old Turkic "ot" - fire)
Loan from Azerbaijani "ox - arrow". (← from old Turkic "ok" (Orkhon inscriptions, 735): [i]"yarıkınta yalmasınta yüz artuk [b]ok[/b]ın urı"[/i]).
Loan from Azerbaijani "yay - bow". (← Mahmud al-Kashgari "Compendium of the languages of the Turks" 1070: "yay - special instrument for throwing an arrow").
Loan from Azerbaijani "qalxan - shield". (← Mahmud al-Kashgari "Compendium of the languages of the Turks" 1070: "kalkan/kalkaŋ". Compare to Mongolian "kalka - shield").
Loan from Arabic "نزاع [nizāˁ] - to rupture, to breakout, to disassemble, to peeling.
Loan from Azerbaijani "qılınc - sword". (← from Old Turkic "kılıç").
Loan from Azerbaijani "quzğun [guzʁun] - hawk, black bird". In Old Turkic "kuz [kuz]" means "sunless place, shadow, darkness".
Loan from Azerbaijani "qarğa - raven". (← Old Turkic (Old Uyghur) "karga - a black bird").

semantics.note: Puppy.
Goat kid.
In Tabasaran language also means squirrel.
